name: Dustoff Heli Rescue
description: "I need a Dustoff!" became an all-too-familiar call on the airwaves of jungle wars. Now take off with your rescue helicopter and search and save the life of the wounded soldiers in the field, often under fire. If you can't, nobody else can!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP3 Processor: Dual core 2 GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: GeForce Go 7600 or ATI Mobility Radeon HD 4650 DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 600 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Quad core 2GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: GeForce GTX 460 or ATI Radeon HD 4670 DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 600 MB available space

reviews.review_text: I really wanted to like this game because I enjoyed Choplifter as a kid but a few issues really dragged down the fun out of it for me.   -odd controls. L and R for left and right, hold both to ascend and let go to decend. Would rather just use the joystick to move and two fave buttons to ascend and decend instead.  -super touchy collision. If your heli gets turned slightly the wrong way boom you're dead.  -extra unlockable helis actually control *worse*. Yes they may have more person capacity and a higher health bar but controls are even more touchy than before especially on higher stages going into caverns and whatnot where space is tight.  -you have to land *extremely* softly. Otherwise you lose a ton of health or worse yet- you explode.   I do like the voxel graphics though. Music and the pilot chatter are nice additions as well. The touchy and weird controls along with poor heli selections just kill the fun.

This game, (For those of you who don't know) was and still is a mobile game. It was ported, but it got updates to it so you can keybind and all that goodness. I do sort of like it, but I wouldn't play through all 25 levels unless it was the only game I had installed and had no internet. The controls are a bit clunky when turning because it turns you SO for over that you can sometimes crash into a tree without going very far up first. To go straight up, you have to press your laft and right buttons at the same time. The shooting is a little odd felling if you have your keys binded to for right on your keyboard, unless you have auto mode on. I give this game a 5/10 because I kind of want a refund. (ERGH STEAM)

First off, this game DOES NOT have full controller support. I may consider changing my recommendation once the label is fixed. It does have partial support.  The game itself is sort of fun, though you can tell it is clearly a mobile port. It's on sale right now for $.59 and totally worth that, but I'm not sure about the normal 4 dollar price tag.
